name: Visual Studio .NET 2003 Build Task
description: Build Visual Studio .NET 2003 solutions and project files.
helpMarkDown: Webprojects: to enable the build of webprojects, this task will create a temporary website for each of them. Depending on the settings (see Advanced), temporary application pools will be created for each website. At the end of the build, all websites (and application pools) created are removed. [More information.](https://github.com/igorguga/VS2003BuildTask/blob/master/README.md)
author: Igor Rosa Macedo

inputs.name: TargetFile
inputs.label: Build Target File(s)
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path to target files (solutions or projects) to be built.

inputs.name: DevEnvPath
inputs.label: DevEnv Path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Agent full path to Microsoft Visual Studio 2003 DevEnv.exe file. If not informed, the agent will search for a VS2003 enviroment variable. If it wasn't defined, the build will fail.

inputs.name: AppPoolName
inputs.label: Webprojects Application Pool
inputs.helpMarkDown: Application Pool to be used with the websites created to build webprojects. If not informed, the build will create a temporary application pool for each website. Important: the appliction pool identity needs to have permissions on the agent source directory.
